comment.author: 30808209@N00
comment._content: Surely, Pierre Monteux is no.2 from the right? As a string quartet violist he had then already played for Johannes Brahms, something that would impress orchestra players when as an eminent senior conductor he happened to mention this fact, so many many decades later on, y compris the Sacre world première etc etc:) In fact, I think this is Grieg and string quartet with Mr. Unknown at the back.

comment.author: 57816495@N00
comment._content: This photograph was taken on the stage of the Salle Pleyel in Paris, at nº 22 rue Rochechouart, the very same concert hall where Chopin performed in 1841, 1842 and 1848 (the hall was demolished in the 1920s).
